page.title: 07Chapel St Leonards Church
page.content: St Leonard church was dedicated to a French Nobleman and Patron Saint of prisoners and peasants.There was a flood in 1572 and the church was rebuilt.Two hundred and fifty years later it was in ruins.It was rebuilt again in 1794 but much smaller,by church warden Robert Empringham.For a long time there were no regular service only when there was money to spare.The church was given some land so that they could earn from it so they could keep the church in repair. The village hall stands on some of the land that they earnt money from.
